content.question: The solvent in the nonaqueous system represented above is <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>-propanol. If a small amount of water is added to the system, how will the color of the solution be affected, and why?

choices.label: The solution will become more pink because more <math alttext="the complex ion C o, open parenthesis, H 2 O, close parenthesis, 6, with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[C</mtext><mtext>o(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> will be produced.
The solution will become more pink because the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the solution will increase.

The solution will become more blue because more <math alttext="the complex ion C o C l 4, with a negative 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[C</mtext><mtext>o</mtext><mtext>C</mtext><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>l</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> will be produced.
The solution will become more blue because the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of the solution will decrease.

content.answer: The solution will become more pink because more <math alttext="the complex ion C o, open parenthesis, H 2 O, close parenthesis, 6, with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[C</mtext><mtext>o(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> will be produced.

skill.text: 6.F: Explain the connection between experimental results and chemical concepts, processes, or theories.
